sentences.en: Deep mining first blighted the West Virginia landscape.
sentences.cn: 深挖矿井首先使弗吉尼亚州的风景遭到破坏.

sentences.en: Her life has been per-manently blighted by his heinous crime.
sentences.cn: 他犯下的滔天罪行给她的生活蒙上了永久的阴影。

sentences.en: Her life was blighted by an unhappy marriage.
sentences.cn: 她的一生被不幸的婚姻所毁.

sentences.en: His career has been blighted by injuries.
sentences.cn: 他的事业不断受到伤病的困扰。

sentences.en: His reputation was blighted by his bad behavior.
sentences.cn: 他的名誉为他的行为不检所毁.

sentences.en: Oh, never more could it turn to him; for faith was blighted - confidence destroyed!
sentences.cn: 哦, 它再也不能转向他, 因为忠诚已给摧残,信任已给毁灭!

sentences.en: Peonies can be blighted by the laying on of a finger.
sentences.cn: 手指触碰会使牡丹花枯萎.

sentences.en: She threw away a blighted rose.
sentences.cn: 她把枯萎的玫瑰花扔掉了。

sentences.en: Some men in his blighted position would have taken to drinking.
sentences.cn: 一些人在倒霉的时候总是借酒浇愁.

sentences.en: The apple trees were blighted by frost.
The disease blighted oaks and elms.
sentences.cn: 疾病使栎树和榆树枯萎。

sentences.en: The dry spell blighted the crops.
sentences.cn: 干旱期使农作物枯萎了.

sentences.en: The frost has blighted my crops.
sentences.cn: 霜冻使我的庄稼枯萎了.

sentences.en: The frost has blighted my potatoes.
sentences.cn: 霜使我的马铃薯枯萎了.

words.tran_cn: 使染上枯萎病；毁坏（blight的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 使凋萎( blight的过去式)，使颓丧，损害，妨害
